com.hcl.domino

Interface DominoClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, IAdaptable

    public interface DominoClient
extends IAdaptable, AutoCloseable
    Used as the entry point and thread management, borrowed from other Java APIs. Handles mapping to Domino server, protocol etc
    Since:
    0.5.0
    Author:
    t.b.d

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  DominoClient.ECLType
      Types of ECL settings
      static class  DominoClient.Encryption
      Available encryption strengths for database creation
      static interface  DominoClient.IBreakHandler
      Implement this method to send break signals to long running operations
      static interface  DominoClient.IProgressListener
      Definition of function that will handle the progress bar signal.

      The progress signal handler displays a progress bar.
      The progress position will generally start at 0 and end at Range.
      The current progress supplied is either absolute (DominoClient.IProgressListener.setPos(long)) or a delta from the previous progress state (DominoClient.IProgressListener.setDeltaPos(long)).
      As the operation which is supplying progress information is performed, the range may change.

      If it does, an additional DominoClient.IProgressListener.setRange(long) will be signaled.
      static interface  DominoClient.LifecycleListener
      Interface for subscribing to DominoClient lifecycle events.
      static interface  DominoClient.NotesReplicationStats
      Replication statistics
      static class  DominoClient.OpenDatabase
      Enum for options for opening the database, if the specified database is not currently available
      static interface  DominoClient.ReplicationStateListener
      Listener to get replication progress

      void compact(String pathname, Set<CompactMode> mode)
      This function compresses a local database to remove the space left by deleting documents, freeing up disk space.
      Deletion stubs however, are left intact in the database.

      ServerPingInfo pingServer(String serverName, boolean retrieveLoadIndex, boolean retrieveClusterInfo)
      Attempts to ping the named server, optionally retrieving additional information.
      DominoClient.NotesReplicationStats replicateDbsWithServer(String serverName, Set<Database.ReplicateOption> options, List<String> fileList, int timeLimitMin, DominoClient.ReplicationStateListener progressListener)
      This routine replicates Domino database files on the local system with a specified server.

      Either all common files can be replicated or a specified list of files can be replicated.

      Replication can be performed in either direction or both directions (push, pull, or both).

      Please note:
      Run this method inside runInterruptable(Callable, IBreakHandler) to be able to cancel the process and inside runWithProgress(Callable, IProgressListener) to get progress info.
      Optional<DominoException> resolveErrorCode(int code)
      Converts a Domino API error code into a DominoException.

      Runs a block of code asynchronously in a background thread

      • createDatabase

        Database createDatabase(String serverName,
                        String filePath,
                        boolean forceCreation,
                        boolean initDesign,
                        DominoClient.Encryption encryption)
        Creates a new database on the target server with a given file path.
        Parameters:
        serverName - Domino server name to connect to, or an empty string for the current server
        filePath - the file path of the destination database
        forceCreation - to overwrite an existing database if applicable
        initDesign - true to run a DXL import on the new database which creates a view and basic structures like the DB icon and the design collection; if false, you need to run your own initialization since the created database cannot yet be opened in the Notes Client
        encryption - encryption level for new database
        Returns:
        a database object for the newly-created database
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if filePath is empty
        DominoException - if the database already exists and forceCreation is false

      • createDatabase

        Database createDatabase(String serverName,
                        String filePath,
                        boolean forceCreation,
                        boolean initDesign,
                        DominoClient.Encryption encryption,
                        DatabaseClass dbClass)
        Creates a new database on the target server with a given file path.
        Parameters:
        serverName - Domino server name to connect to, or an empty string for the current server
        filePath - the file path of the destination database
        forceCreation - to overwrite an existing database if applicable
        initDesign - true to run a DXL import on the new database which creates a view and basic structures like the DB icon and the design collection; if false, you need to run your own initialization since the created database cannot yet be opened in the Notes Client
        encryption - encryption level for new database
        dbClass - type of database to create
        Returns:
        a database object for the newly-created database
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if filePath is empty
        DominoException - if the database already exists and forceCreation is false

      • createDatabaseFromTemplate

        Database createDatabaseFromTemplate(String sourceServerName,
                                    String sourceFilePath,
                                    String targetServerName,
                                    String targetFilePath,
                                    DominoClient.Encryption encryption)
        Creates a new database from the specified template DB. Handles copying all design/data documents, setting the inherited template name and creating a ACL based on ACL entries of the template, e.g. a "[Group1]" entry of the template becomes a "Group1" entry in the created DB.
        Parameters:
        sourceServerName - server name of template database
        sourceFilePath - filepath of template database
        targetServerName - Domino server name to connect to, or an empty string for the current server
        targetFilePath - the file path of the destination database
        encryption - encryption level for new database
        Returns:
        a database object for the newly-created database

      • createDatabaseReplica

        Database createDatabaseReplica(String sourceServerName,
                               String sourceFilePath,
                               String targetServerName,
                               String targetFilePath,
                               DominoClient.Encryption encryption)
        Creates a new database replica, which is a new database with copied design/data documents and the same replica ID as the specified DB.
        Parameters:
        sourceServerName - server name of database to create the replica for
        sourceFilePath - filepath of database to create the replica for
        targetServerName - Domino server name to connect to, or an empty string for the current server
        targetFilePath - the file path of the destination database
        encryption - encryption level for new database
        Returns:
        a database object for the newly-created replica database

      • openDatabase

        Database openDatabase(String path)
        Opens a database by path. This path may be relative to the data directory of the current machine or may contain the name of a remote server. The database path may also be a replica ID.

        Some examples of legal database paths are:

        • foo/bar.nsf
        • 852584A8:00507284
        • ServerName/OrgName!!foo/bar.nsf
        • CN=ServerName/O=OrgName!!foo/bar.nsf
        • ServerName/OrgName!!852584A8:00507284
        Parameters:
        path - a path of the database
        Returns:
        database object for data access

      • openDatabase

        Database openDatabase(String path,
                      Set<DominoClient.OpenDatabase> options)
        Opens a database by path. This path may be relative to the data directory of the current machine or may contain the name of a remote server. The database path may also be a replica ID.

        Some examples of legal database paths are:

        • foo/bar.nsf
        • 852584A8:00507284
        • ServerName/OrgName!!foo/bar.nsf
        • CN=ServerName/O=OrgName!!foo/bar.nsf
        • ServerName/OrgName!!852584A8:00507284
        Parameters:
        path - a path of the database
        options - set of options for if the database is not accessible
        Returns:
        Database database object for data access

      • openDatabase

        Database openDatabase(String serverName,
                      String filePath)
        Opens a database. Data queries against a remote server will be slower
        Parameters:
        serverName - Domino server name to connect to, or an empty string for the current server
        filePath - path of the database relative to Domino's data directory or a replica ID
        Returns:
        Database database object for data access

        Parameters:

        filePath - path of the database relative to Domino's data directory or a replica ID
        options - set of options for if the database is not accessible
        Returns:
        Database database object for data access

      • runInterruptable

        <T> T runInterruptable(Callable<T> callable,
                       DominoClient.IBreakHandler breakHandler)
        The method registers a break signal handler for the execution time of the specified Callable. The break signal handler can be used to send a break signal to Domino so that the current (probably long running) operation, e.g. a fulltext on a remote database, can be interrupted.
        Type Parameters:
        T - result type
        Parameters:
        callable - callable to execute
        breakHandler - break handler to interrupt the current operation
        Returns:
        optional result

      • runWithProgress

        <T> T runWithProgress(Callable<T> callable,
                      DominoClient.IProgressListener progressHandler)
        The method registers a progress signal handler for the execution time of the specified Callable. The progress signal handler can be used to get notified about the progress of method execution, e.g. replication or copy operations.
        Type Parameters:
        T - result type
        Parameters:
        callable - callable to execute
        progressHandler - progress handler to get notified about progress changes
        Returns:
        optional result

      • createDateTime

        DominoDateTime createDateTime(TemporalAccessor temporal)
        Creates a DominoDateTime instance for the provided TemporalAccessor object.
        Some examples of supported TemporalAccessor value:
        • DominoDateTime
        • Instant.now()
        • LocalDate.now()
        • LocalTime.now()
        • ZoneId zone = ZoneId.systemDefault(); Instant now=Instant.now(); OffsetDateTime.ofInstant(now, zone);
        Parameters:
        temporal - the temporal implementation to convert; must not be null
        Returns:
        a DominoDateTime instance that represents the value of temporal
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if temporal is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if temporal contains a time zone that cannot be expressed in 15-minute increments

      • createDateRange

        DominoDateRange createDateRange(TemporalAccessor start,
                                TemporalAccessor end)
        Creates a new DominoDateRange of two Temporal values. Some examples of supported Temporal value:
        • Instant.now()
        • LocalDate.now()
        • LocalTime.now()
        • ZoneId zone = ZoneId.systemDefault(); Instant now=Instant.now(); OffsetDateTime.ofInstant(now, zone);
        Parameters:
        start - start temporal
        end - end temporal
        Returns:
        range

      • createUNID

        DominoUniversalNoteId createUNID(String unidStr)
        Creates a DominoUniversalNoteId for a given UNID string that can be used in Document.replaceItemValue(String, Object) to create an item of type ItemDataType.TYPE_NOTEREF_LIST to reference another Document, e.g. in a response hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        unidStr - UNID String
        Returns:
        Domino universal id

        Returns:
        converter

      • replicateDbsWithServer

        DominoClient.NotesReplicationStats replicateDbsWithServer(String serverName,
                                                          Set<Database.ReplicateOption> options,
                                                          List<String> fileList,
                                                          int timeLimitMin,
                                                          DominoClient.ReplicationStateListener progressListener)
        This routine replicates Domino database files on the local system with a specified server.

        Either all common files can be replicated or a specified list of files can be replicated.

        Replication can be performed in either direction or both directions (push, pull, or both).

        Please note:
        Run this method inside runInterruptable(Callable, IBreakHandler) to be able to cancel the process and inside runWithProgress(Callable, IProgressListener) to get progress info.
        Parameters:
        serverName - destination server (either abbreviated or canonical format)
        options - replication options
        fileList - list of files to replicate, use server!!filepath format to specify databases on other servers
        timeLimitMin - If non-zero, number of minutes replication is allowed to execute before cancellation. If not specified, no limit is imposed
        progressListener - replication progress listener or null if not required
        Returns:
        replication stats

      • getServerAdmin

        ServerAdmin getServerAdmin()
        Returns a utility class with server administration features
        Returns:
        admin utils

      • getIdVault

        IdVault getIdVault()

      • getKnownServers

        Collection<String> getKnownServers(String portName)
        Retrieves a list of servers known to the current Domino environment.
        Parameters:
        portName - the port name to query, or null for all ports
        Returns:
        a Collection of distinguished server names

      • getDatabasePaths

        DatabaseChangePathList getDatabasePaths(String serverName,
                                        TemporalAccessor modifiedSince)
        Retrieves a list of databases on the target server, optionally restricted to those modified since a given time.
        Parameters:
        serverName - the server to query, or null for local
        modifiedSince - the start time of the query, or null for all databases
        Returns:
        a DatabaseChangePathList object containing the path list and new since time

      • getPerson

        Returns a utility class that provides information about a user
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        person class

      • validateCredentials

        String validateCredentials(String serverName,
                           String userName,
                           String password)
                    throws NameNotFoundException,
                           AuthenticationException,
                           AuthenticationNotSupportedException
        Attempts to validate the provider username and password credentials using the named server.
        Parameters:
        serverName - the name of the server to validate against, or null to use the local runtime
        userName - a name for the user; may be a short name or other user ID
        password - the password to check for the user
        Returns:
        the user's canonical name in Notes format
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if userName is empty
        NameNotFoundException - if the provided name cannot be found in any directory
        AuthenticationException - if the provided password does not match the user's password
        AuthenticationNotSupportedException - if the user exists but does not have a specified password

      • validateCredentialsWithToken

        String validateCredentialsWithToken(String serverName,
                                    Object token)
                             throws NameNotFoundException,
                                    AuthenticationException,
                                    AuthenticationNotSupportedException
        Attempts to validate the provided credentials token with any registered providers.
        Parameters:
        token - the token to use to authenticate. The class of the token depends on the available provider implementations
        serverName - the name of the server to contact
        Returns:
        the in-memory user ID
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when no provider can be found to handle token
        NameNotFoundException - if the implementation finds that the name cannot be found
        AuthenticationException - if the implementation finds that the credentials cannot be validated
        AuthenticationNotSupportedException - if the implementation finds that the user exists but cannot be validated with that token
        UnsupportedOperationException - if no implementation is found that can handle the provided token
        Since:
        1.0.19

      • getEcl

        Ecl getEcl(DominoClient.ECLType eclType,
           String userName)
        Returns the Ecl for a username (what the user is allowed to do)
        Parameters:

        userName - username either abbreviated or canonical
        Returns:
        ECL

           List<String> namesList)

        Parameters:

        namesList - usernameslist, e.g. with the same content as @UserNamesList
        Returns:

      • openUserDirectory

        UserDirectory openUserDirectory(String serverName)
        Opens the effective user directory for the provided server. This allows lookup of user, server, and group names using the server's primary and secondary directories.
        Parameters:
        serverName - the name of the server to query, or null to use the local runtime
        Returns:
        the UserDirectory for the server
        Since:
        1.0.2

      • getAdministrationProcess

        AdministrationProcess getAdministrationProcess(String serverName)
        Creates a new AdministrationProcess object
        Parameters:
        serverName - The name of the server containing the Administration Requests database (ADMIN4.NSF). An empty string means the local computer. The server must contain a replica of the Certification Log. You must have access privileges to the Domino Directory on the server for Administration Process requests that use it
        Returns:
        The newly created Administration Process object

      • close

        void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • addLifecycleListener

        void addLifecycleListener(DominoClient.LifecycleListener listener)
        Adds a listener to the client that will be called when certain lifecycle events occur.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add
        Since:
        1.0.2

      • compact

        void compact(String pathname,
             Set<CompactMode> mode)
        This function compresses a local database to remove the space left by deleting documents, freeing up disk space.
        Deletion stubs however, are left intact in the database.
        Parameters:
        pathname - path of local database
        mode - compact flags

      • pingServer

        ServerPingInfo pingServer(String serverName,
                          boolean retrieveLoadIndex,
                          boolean retrieveClusterInfo)
        Attempts to ping the named server, optionally retrieving additional information.
        Parameters:
        serverName - the name of the server to ping
        retrieveLoadIndex - whether to query the server's availability index
        retrieveClusterInfo - whether to query the server's cluster name and peers
        Returns:
        a ServerPingInfo instance optionally containing load index and cluster information
        Throws:
        ServerNotFoundException - if the server cannot be resolved
        ServerUnavailableException - if the server is resolved but busy
        ServerRestrictedException - if the server is resolved but restricted
        Since:
        1.0.20

      • getBuildVersion

        BuildVersionInfo getBuildVersion(String server)
        This function returns a BuildVersionInfo object which contains all types of information about the level of code running on the specified server.

        See BuildVersionInfo for more information.
        Parameters:
        server - to check the version for, e.g. "" for local environment
        Returns:
        version

      • resolveErrorCode

        Optional<DominoException> resolveErrorCode(int code)
        Converts a Domino API error code into a DominoException.
        Parameters:
        code - error code
        Returns:
        an Optional describing a newly-created instance of DominoException or a subclass, an empty one if result is 0
